subject: Programming
title: Linear Search
description: A fast breakdown of Linear Search for builders.

hook.text: You lost your keys. You check every pocket, one by one, until you find them.

buildup.text: Linear search checks every element in order. Simple, reliable, and impossible to get wrong.

discovery.text: It runs in O(n) time. On average, you'll check half the list before finding the target.

twist.text: On an unsorted list, linear search is the only option. No clever trick can skip elements safely.

climax.text: Simple doesn't mean bad. For small lists, linear search often beats complex alternatives.

punchline.text: Sometimes checking everything is the smartest move.

quiz.question: What is the time complexity of linear search?
